title: Create an AI/ML blog category
description:
## Goal

We would like to add a new AI/ML category to the blog page.

Currently we are using the tag archive, which isn't super useable and isn't compelling: https://about.gitlab.com/blog/tags.html#AI/ML

We'd like support for a category archive like this: https://about.gitlab.com/blog/categories/open-source/

#### Jobs To Be Done

title: [ENG] Blog template: Replace Disqus comments integration with feedback CTA to the community forum
description:
## Goal
We want to remove Disqus as comment function on the GitLab blog. This will improve the page load speed, and remove the amount of spam and moderation tasks on blog comments. 

We would also like to match the blog bottom CTA to our Marketing site CTA


## Designs
[Figma](https://www.figma.com/file/5mgvis6M0z3GN5kuEFADoW/CMS-%2F-Blog-Post?node-id=2206%3A3001&t=slOPtEnMsMF2qyzR-1)



**What analytics / data will we need to set-up?**
- [x] Yes: The click should have data attributes to track
- [ ] No

## Page(s)
Which page(s) are involved in this request?
* All blog pages, using the blog template. Example: https://about.gitlab.com/blog/2023/03/30/ml-experiment-sql/ 


The blog footer should include a "form" that invites users to provide their feedback. Something similar to docs.gitlab.com footer, but only for comments.

```
:bulb: Enjoyed reading this blog post, or have questions or feedback? Please create a [new topic at the GitLab community forum](https://forum.gitlab.com/new-topic?title=Blog%20title&body=Hi,%20edit%20me&tags=blog-feedback). 
```

The prepared URL will open up a new form to create a topic with pre-filled data. Anonymous users are asked to sign-up/login automatically by forum.gitlab.com 

![image](/uploads/b710f246267a302379f0a08b150fa9cb/image.png)


Example from https://docs.gitlab.com/runner/#license 

![image](/uploads/81f32be35dc2b55e945131594057d18d/image.png)

## DCI
[DRI, Consulted, Informed](https://about.gitlab.com/handbook/people-group/directly-responsible-individuals/#dri-consulted-informed-dci)

- [ ] DRI: @takamine-ext 
- [ ] Consulted: @justin.vetter @fqureshi @trevor-storey 
- [ ] Informed: `Everyone`

## In scope
What is within scope of this request?

- [ ] Add a forum feedback CTA on the blog footer
- [ ] Remove the Disqus integration in the blog template

## Requirements
What are the requirements for this request? Checklist below is an example of common requirements, please check all that apply and adjust as necessary:

- [ ] Copy writing
- [ ] Illustration
- [ ] Custom Graphics
- [ ] Research
- [ ] Data / Analytics
- [ ] UX Design
- [x] Engineering

yarn run v1.22.19

title: [ENG] hreflang attribute MVC2
description:
## Goal
We would like iterated on the href lang attributes to robot directives of our localized pages. For this iteration we need to:

* The current `hreflang` URLs are ouputted as relative paths, ie `/de-de/sales` this needs to change to absolute paths ie `https://about.gitlab.com/de-de/sales/`
* Add missing trailing slash (/) at the end of each `hreflang` URL to prevent redirects
* The language pages have 2 robot directives in the `head`, `index,follow` and `noindex,nofollow`. This will give conflicting directives to search engines.

This effects all localized pages: 

* https://about.gitlab.com/enterprise/ (relative URLs used: /de-de/enterprise, /enterprise, /fr-fr/enterprise, /jp-jp/enterprise)
* https://about.gitlab.com/sales/ (relative URLs used: /de-de/sales, /sales, /fr-fr/sales, /jp-jp/sales)
* https://about.gitlab.com/small-business/ (relative URLs used: /de-de/small-business, /small-business, /fr-fr/small-business, /jp-jp/small-business)
* https://about.gitlab.com/teamops/ (relative URLs used: /de-de/teamops, /teamops, /fr-fr/teamops, /jp-jp/teamops)
* More being launched - add to list here

## In scope
What is within scope of this request?

- [x] Change to hreflang attribute to absolute paths with trailing slash for all localized pages
- [x] Change to 1 robot directive - `noindex,nofollow`- for all localized pages


## DCI
[DRI, Consulted, Informed](https://about.gitlab.com/handbook/people-group/directly-responsible-individuals/#dri-consulted-informed-dci)

description:

title: MVC5 Navigation - Hover effect on links
description:
### Describe the Bug
The 'GitLab Ultimate' and 'GitLab Premium' link hover effect happens at the same time. We will require the chevron hover effect to only happen once a user hovers over a single link.

**The correct behaviour should be as follows:**

- User hovers solutions navigation
- User hovers the 'Try our pricing calculator' or 'Pricing plans' section in the navigation and the background changes to purple
- Clicking on the section should not open any of the links in the section
- User hovers a link in the section and the hover effect of the chevron activates
- User can select a single link item and be taken to that page

**Example of current bug, with both chevrons moving at the same time once the section is hovered:**

![MC5NavBug](/uploads/ee92639e76ad4126ae0291d9058ec0e4/MC5NavBug.png)

title: [ENG] Hreflang Attribute Implementation for Sales, Teamops, Enterprise
description:
## Goal
We would like add hreflang attributes to our Teamops and Sales pages and enterprise - all versions (english, french, german, and japanese)

#### Please provide more information related to this engineering request
Make sure the information you provide is relevant for your request. If unsure, please provide all the fields. Add/remove rows as needed.

## Which page(s) are involved in this request?
- https://about.gitlab.com/teamops/
- https://about.gitlab.com/ja-jp/teamops/
- https://about.gitlab.com/fr-fr/teamops/
- https://about.gitlab.com/de-de/teamops/
- https://about.gitlab.com/sales/
- https://about.gitlab.com/ja-jp/sales/
- https://about.gitlab.com/fr-fr/sales/
- https://about.gitlab.com/de-de/sales/
- https://about.gitlab.com/enterprise/
- https://about.gitlab.com/ja-jp/enterprise/
- https://about.gitlab.com/fr-fr/enterprise/
- https://about.gitlab.com/de-de/enterprise/

## Code to add to each page

The following code must be added to https://about.gitlab.com/teamops/.

```
<link href='https://about.gitlab.com/teamops/' hreflang=x-default rel=alternate />
<link href='https://about.gitlab.com/ja-jp/teamops/' hreflang=ja-jp rel=alternate />
<link href='https://about.gitlab.com/fr-fr/teamops/' hreflang=fr-fr rel=alternate />
<link href='https://about.gitlab.com/fr-fr/teamops/' hreflang=fr rel=alternate />
<link href='https://about.gitlab.com/de-de/teamops/' hreflang=de-de rel=alternate />
<link href='https://about.gitlab.com/de-de/teamops/' hreflang=de rel=alternate />
```

For the language pages eg `/fr-fr/teamops/` the `hreflang` implementation should look like this:

```
<link href='https://about.gitlab.com/teamops/' hreflang=x-default rel=alternate />
<link href='https://about.gitlab.com/ja-jp/teamops/' hreflang=ja-jp rel=alternate />
<link href='https://about.gitlab.com/fr-fr/teamops/' hreflang=fr-fr rel=alternate />
<link href='https://about.gitlab.com/fr-fr/teamops/' hreflang=fr rel=alternate />
<link href='https://about.gitlab.com/de-de/teamops/' hreflang=de-de rel=alternate />
<link href='https://about.gitlab.com/de-de/teamops/' hreflang=de rel=alternate />
```

The same format should be applied to every localized version of our pages.

title: [ENG] Bug - Fix info overlap on tablet size of pricing page
description:
## Goal
We would like to fix the tablet size pricing page which will improve usability as measured by conversion. Why is this changed needed?

### Describe the Bug
What is the bug?

On tablet and smaller computer sizes, our pricing tiers CTAs and the items directly beneath are overlapping correctly:

| Surface Pro 7 | iPad Air | iPad Mini |
| ------ | ------ | ------ |
|    ![Screenshot_2023-03-22_at_10.11.27](/uploads/7c42f7b2f2e9d4224a1a0011d8474bc1/Screenshot_2023-03-22_at_10.11.27.png)    |    ![Screenshot_2023-03-22_at_10.11.18](/uploads/a813d551b0671edece4fcc84dc159431/Screenshot_2023-03-22_at_10.11.18.png)    |    ![Screenshot_2023-03-22_at_10.10.42](/uploads/b32f2b6da790717ee7ec70bf2d1e7819/Screenshot_2023-03-22_at_10.10.42.png)    |

### What's my browser? 
Share your browser information from https://www.whatsmybrowser.org/ 

https://www.whatsmybrowser.org/b/GRX0L

## Page(s)
Which page(s) are involved in this request?
* `[Pricing Page](https://about.gitlab.com/pricing/)`

## Requirements
What are the requirements for this request? Checklist below is an example of common requirements, please check all that apply and adjust as necessary:

- [ ] Copy writing
- [ ] Illustration
- [ ] Custom Graphics
- [ ] Research
- [ ] Data / Analytics
- [ ] UX Design
- [x] Engineering
